title.narrative: UNDP support to Integrated Reconciliation in Iraq

description.narrative: Part of the Syria Iraq Regional Stabilisation Programme 2016-2018 under the the thematic area 1: Political dialogue and peace building

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Enhanced social cohesion in targeted communities and regions, as well as higher levels of trust between these communities/regions and the national leadership in Baghdad.

• 1.1. # of community and provincial reconciliation processes established • 1.2. # of agreements signed by conflicting parties • 1.3. # of agreements implemented to satisfaction of parties • 1.4. 30% women representation; 30% youth representation, proportional minority representation; • 1.5. 15% increase in social cohesion in targeted communities per annum

target.value: 1.1. 6 community/provincial reconciliation processes are established 1.2. 6 agreements are signed by conflicting parties 1.3. 6 agreements are implemented to satisfaction of parties 1.4. Vulnerable groups [gender 30%. youth 30%. minorities (proportional %)] are represented in local peace processes and help to shape their outcomes 1.5. Baseline studies conducted in 6 targeted areas

actual.value: 1.1: 24 LPCs were established; 1.2: Signing of agreements not reported (6 LPCs facilitated return of IDP families); 1.3: Implementation of agreements not reported (signing not reported); 1.4: no reporting; 1.5: no reporting

title.narrative: Public awareness of the needs and possibilities for reconciliation and transitional justice increase in selected areas.
• 2.1. Increased Public Awareness of the needs and possibilities for reconciliation and transitional justice as measured by social cohesion tool • 2.2. Increased media coverage, impact and responses

target.value: 2.1. Public awareness of reconciliation is raised during election period by 15% 2.2. 20% increase of public awareness is raised over the period of 2018 as measured by the SCORE INDEX.

actual.value: 2.1: Reporting does not verify target. 2.2.: Due to political reasons the project was not able to establish a social cohesion and reconciliation Index for Iraq (SCORE)

title.narrative: Public awareness of the needs and possibilities for reconciliation and transitional justice increase in selected areas.
• 2.1. Increased Public Awareness of the needs and possibilities for reconciliation and transitional justice as measured by social cohesion tool • 2.2. Increased media coverage, impact and responses

target.value: 2.1. Public awareness of reconciliation is raised during election period by 15% 2.2. 20% increase of public awareness is raised over the period of 2018 as measured by the SCORE INDEX.

actual.value: 2.1: Reporting does not verify target. 2.2.: Due to political reasons the project was not able to establish a social cohesion and reconciliation Index for Iraq (SCORE)

title.narrative: Partners conduct joint preparatory work towards the establishment of a comprehensive victim support programme
A comprehensive victim support programme for Iraq is implemented

target.value: 3.1: Report to analyze legal frameworks for victim support and transitional justice published and disseminated to GoI and international community; 3.2: Report to analyze existing documentation initiatives is published and disseminated to GoI and international community; 3.3: Mechanism is designed to document. archive and disseminate GHVs and formal support gained from GoI; 3.4: Oral history initiatives are established in selected pilot areas. with a special emphasis on gender; 3.5: 10 specific victim support initiatives are capacitated; 3.6: 10 specific victim support initiatives are established where no such initiatives existed.

actual.value: 3.1: Analytical study developed and submitted to MOLSA- Women Protection Directorate on how to re-design existing MOLSA protocols to strengthen victim assistance policies. 3.2: Not undertaken; 3.3: Not undertaken; 3.4: 30 social workers screened with MOLSA for advanced training on data collection from victims of GBV collecting over 100 stories from the victims of GBV in Nineveh. Salah Al-Din. Diyala. Anbar. Baghdad. Karbala. Babil. Misan. Kirkuk and Basrah.

title.narrative: Partners conduct joint preparatory work towards the establishment of a comprehensive victim support programme
A comprehensive victim support programme for Iraq is implemented

target.value: 3.1: Report to analyze legal frameworks for victim support and transitional justice published and disseminated to GoI and international community; 3.2: Report to analyze existing documentation initiatives is published and disseminated to GoI and international community; 3.3: Mechanism is designed to document. archive and disseminate GHVs and formal support gained from GoI; 3.4: Oral history initiatives are established in selected pilot areas. with a special emphasis on gender; 3.5: 10 specific victim support initiatives are capacitated; 3.6: 10 specific victim support initiatives are established where no such initiatives existed.

actual.value: 3.1: Analytical study developed and submitted to MOLSA- Women Protection Directorate on how to re-design existing MOLSA protocols to strengthen victim assistance policies. 3.2: Not undertaken; 3.3: Not undertaken; 3.4: 30 social workers screened with MOLSA for advanced training on data collection from victims of GBV collecting over 100 stories from the victims of GBV in Nineveh. Salah Al-Din. Diyala. Anbar. Baghdad. Karbala. Babil. Misan. Kirkuk and Basrah.

title.narrative: Preparatory work towards an archive of community narratives related to violations of human rights is conducted.

1. # of consultations and dissemination workshops carried out on two TJ reports by UNDP 2. # of oral histories collected from vulnerable groups (disaggregated by gender) 3. # of people participating in local documentation initiatives (disaggregated by gender) 4. # of Circulation and dissemination of oral histories 5. # of MOLSA social workers trained 6. # of victim cases handled by MOLSA after training 7. # of victims receiving psycho-social support 8. # of victims receiving legal aid

target.value: • 4 dissemination workshops are held with GoI and international experts on UNDP reports on TJ • 5 partnerships for victim support are established • 250 women participate in oral history training • Coordination mechanism for documentation of GHVs is designed and support gained from GoI • Referral system for psychosocial support and legal assistance is designed and support gained from GoI • 50 MOLSA workers are capacitated in transitional justice and psycho-social screening • Community needs assessment is conducted in three sample areas on need and priorities for reparations

title.narrative: Awareness campaigns to inform target communities of reconciliation and transitional justice are designed and carried out

1. # of videos produced as campaign material 2. # of views/hits/responses elicited by campaign material 3. % increase in individuals who believe reconciliation can be achieved 4. # of tweets, hits, likes and selected other indicators of social media impact

target.value: • 10 campaign videos are produced and disseminated through all major news outlets • Impact of these videos is measured by professional media tracking service • 10 volunteers per community for 6 communities (60 in total) are recruited to assist in public awareness raising • At least 3 public events are organized for each community by volunteers • 30 key journalists are identified. capacitated and deployed to raise awareness of reconciliation during elections • Each journalist publishes at least 3 pieces on reconciliation • Social media presence of project is established across most relevant applications and programmes • Facebook page gain 1000 followers • Twitter account gain 5000 followers

title.narrative: Active networks of Local Peace Committees are established.
1. # of new LPCs created and capacitated 2. Social Cohesion measurement tool developed 3. # of communities where Social Cohesion tool is implemented

target.value: 6 community/• Up to 6 new LPCs are established. two of which are women-only committees • Up to 6 LPCs are capacitated • Up to 6 LPCs produce agreements and implement workplan • First round social cohesion studies conducted in 6 target communities
